metadata.title: CVE-2019-19920 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
sa-exim 4.2.1 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code if they can writea .cf file or a rule. This occurs because Greylisting.pm relies on eval(rather than direct parsing and/or use of the taint feature). This issue issimilar to CVE-2018-11805.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19920` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sa-exim - 4.2.1-14+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sa-exim package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.1-14+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
